stepAnswer: SELECT * FROM Orders LEFT JOIN Customers ON Orders.CustomerId $$=$$ Customers.Id;
stepBody: Which SQL statement will return all rows from the Orders table and only the matching rows from the Customers table based on the CustomerId?
answerLatex: SELECT * FROM Orders LEFT JOIN Customers ON Orders.CustomerId $$=$$ Customers.Id;
choices: SELECT * FROM Orders LEFT JOIN Customers ON Orders.CustomerId $$=$$ Customers.Id;
SELECT * FROM Orders RIGHT JOIN Customers ON Orders.CustomerId $$=$$ Customers.Id;
SELECT * FROM Orders INNER JOIN Customers ON Orders.CustomerId $$=$$ Customers.Id;
SELECT * FROM Orders FULL JOIN Customers ON Orders.CustomerId $$=$$ Customers.Id;
